alert.note: Alert for Jewell; Mitchell; Osborne; Phillips; Rooks; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 12 at 1:04PM CDT until April 13 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS TODAY AND THURSDAY... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR ALL OF SOUTH CENTRAL NEBRASKA AND NORTH CENTRAL KANSAS... ...ANOTHER RED FLAG WARNING WILL BE IN EFFECT FOR SAME AREAS FROM NOON TO 9 PM CDT THURSDAY... The National Weather Service in Hastings has issued a Red Flag Warning for strong wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect until 9PM this evening, and again from noon to 9 PM CDT Thursday. The Fire Weather Watch for Thursday is no longer in effect. * WINDS...For today, south winds of 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. For Thursday, south winds of 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 15 to 25 percent, lowest west of the Tri-Cities. * IMPACTS...Any fires that ignite may spread rapidly. Use caution if engaging in activities that may result in a fire starting.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Jewell; Mitchell; Osborne; Phillips; Rooks; Smith
